Napoleon usually liked to look at the killed and wounded.
Napoleon considered this testing his strength of mind.
The horrible appearance of the battlefield overcame Napoleon's strength of mind which he thought constituted his merit and greatness.
Napoleon rode hurriedly from the battlefield and returned to the Shevárdino knoll.
Napoleon sat on his campstool.
Napoleon had a sallow face swollen and heavy.
Napoleon had dim eyes.

Napoleon regarded himself as a participant in the action.
